title: Profile folder does not exist
content: Hello, When I want to backup my profile, i get an error because the profile folder does not exist. In fact, there is no Thunderbird folder in c:\Users\danie\AppData\Roaming. I found this folder and all my data inside the folder C:\Users\danie\AppData\Local\Packages\MozillaThunderbird.MZLA_h5892qc0xkpca\LocalCache\Roaming\. My Thunderbird is running fine, except that I cannot backup my profile (as it does not exist). The folder when my profile is located currently seems to be a cache folder and I scare that it disappears when the cache will be cleared out. Please help me.

title: Migrate from 102.11.0 to 128.6
content:
Hello,

Moving from an older Ubuntu 18.04 machine where Thunderbird is limited to version 102 to a newer machine running Mint 22 where the current version is 128.6

According to https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/upgrading-older-version-thunderbird This should work without issue but the latest version mentioned in the article was 115.

Any change since the article was written? Do I need to install older versions to handle the migration to the latest?

Alternately would using the Export / import tools be better for this task than transferring the profiles?

Thank you

title: can't sign into Thunderbird
content:
My wire has a spectrum account and a Thunderbird account. Spectrum did something that locked her out of Thunderbird. Tried everything and it will not connect. Many people that have a spectrum account have told me that they have the same problem. One of T Bird's moderators told me to take screen shots (David GG) to send to him to analyze if all my setting are correct. I am in my 80's so things are a bit slower for me to grasp. I cannot add them to this form only by email. I would love to get T Bird up and running again for her as she has lost her hearing and this is her only enjoyment. I do have the screenshots in my email.

Thank you

Thanks Richard Buzzard buzzard2841@gmail.com My wife's email is sandog1@cfl.rr.com

Thank you
creator: buzzard2841

title: Overscaled images
content:
Oi!

At work (I can't update) I use Thunderbird Desktop Version 102.5.0 (64-bit). I have a large monitor, so the system's 'Scale and layout' is set to 150%, which suits me.

When I create a new message in Thunderbird: • The text size in the message is fine, • The text size in the menus and buttons is fine, • But I don't like that the inline image is also upscaled.

The image should still be at 100%, just like it appears in Photoshop, which also has appropriately upscaled menus. Please see attached image.

I would be extremely grateful to anyone who is willing to help me with this issue. P.S.: Maybe if I could set the image size in the default message template (perhaps using CSS)?

br, grisax :)
creator: grisax
